alert.note: Alert for Houston; Humphreys; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 7:26AM CDT until July 19 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Houston, Humphreys and Stewart. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen this morning and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain can be expected through 9am. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hurricane Creek, Leatherwood Creek, Whiteoak Creek, Standing Rock Creek, Turkey Creek, Big Richland Creek including Trinity, Little Richland Creek and Cane Creek including Stewart. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waverly, Camden, Tennessee Ridge and Houston County Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
